text.p: The following are the reports carried by Estonia's newspapers on Friday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy:
- Three people received slight injuries when a tram and a trolley-bus collided in the centre of Tallinn.
- A seminar in Tallinn by insurance firm Polaris and ERA-bank proposed establishing a private health insurance system in Estonia.
- Police chief Ain Seppik dismissed three police officers in Narva for insufficient knowledge of the Estonian language; 69 officers have to improve their Estonian by the autumn.
- Specialists criticize the communications part of the Estonian Tiger's Leap computer project.
- The city government in Parnu approved a decree prohibiting tobacco and alcohol advertisements on its territory from June.
- The new owners of Oru Peat Industry plan to produce cut peat and want to demolish the crumbling plant building, a representative said.
